page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: The main railway line from Liverpool Street station to Cambridge runs alongside the canal and was opened in 1848. Local trains from London to Bishop's Stortford use overhead electric power lines suspended from gantries, but the express trains going beyond Bishop's Stortford are hauled by type 47 diesel-electric locomo- tives. The A414 has recently been re-numbered and as we write there are extensive roadworks in progress at the junction of the road up from Roydon and the A 414 to divert the road round Stanstead Abbots in order to avoid the level-crossing at St Margaret's station. Traffic counts were taken on Elizabeth Way and the A 414. The results are shown on the following page.
